item.title: Repeating a writeln
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

deoxys505:

only had letters and #'s in them

lol that would have been very useful…

Here is a quick script I made to send every key from 00000 to 99,999 which is 5 characters, and then if that doesn’t work, then it will try, 000000 to 999,999, if that doesn’t work, it will keep trying an extra digit until it cracks the password.

I’m kind of stoked cause I get to use my ZeroFunction in my second script. :eek:

{ Program By Ron.

  Instructions:
    1. Bring up the rar password window and then drag the target on it.
    2. Run the script.
    3. If the script goes too quickly, then it will not be able to check
    every character so you may want to increase the WaitT in the const
    from 0 to something like... 20 or 40 or something.
    4. If all else fails, then just google rar password cracker or
    something and you'll probably find one. Good Luck.
}

program ProgramByRon;

const
  WaitT     = 0;  // How long each wait is before it tries again?
  MinDigits = 1;  // Check characters with this many digits minimum.
  MaxDigits = 25; // Check characters with this many digits maximum.
  
var
  a,i,Time : integer;

// ZeroDigits() will add 0's for digits not filled up by the Number.
// Made by Ron :)
function ZeroDigits(Number, Digits : Integer) : String;
var
  Str : String;
begin
  Str := IntToStr(Number);
  while (Length(Str) < Digits) do
  begin
    insert('0',Str,1);
  end;
  Result := Str;
end;

procedure CheckNumbers(Digits : Integer);
var
  Num : String;
begin
  for i := 1 to Digits do
  begin
    Num := Num + '9';
  end;
  for i := 0 to StrToInt(Num) do
  begin
    SendKeys(IntToStr(i)+Chr(13))
    Wait(WaitT);
    WriteLn('Tried: '+ZeroDigits(i, Digits));
  end;
end;

begin
  ClearDebug;
  a := MinDigits;
  Time := GetSystemTime;
  repeat
    WriteLn('Checking '+IntToStr(a)+' many digit(s) now.');
    CheckNumbers(a);
    a := a + 1;
  until(IsFKeyDown(12))or(a > MaxDigits)
  WriteLn('Script finished in: '+IntToStr((GetSystemTime-Time)/1000)+' seconds.');
end.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: Repeating a writeln
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I don’t really understand what you mean, but I think you mean, you want it to create a totally random string each time and then display it in your debug box. Well looks like your code is working then, cause its generating a new string each time and looping writeln too.

By the way, mayeb if you used standards, it may help you debug problems in the future.

This is your code formatted:

program New;

const
  theString= 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz';

var
  i : integer;
  theRandomStuff : string;

function randomNumber: integer;
begin
  result:= random(10);
end;

function randomLetter: string;
begin
  result:= copy(theString, random(25), 1);
end;

procedure generator;
begin
  for i:= 1 to random(20) + 5 do
  begin
    case random(2) of
      0: theRandomStuff:= theRandomStuff + inttostr(randomNumber);
      1: theRandomStuff:= theRandomStuff + randomLetter;
    end;
  end;
  writeln(theRandomStuff);
end;

begin
  ClearDebug;
  repeat
    generator;
    delete(therandomstuff,1,20+random(5));
  until(false);
end.

Try my version of this RandomString Generator

program RandomStringGeneratorByRon;

var
  i : integer;
  
procedure Generate;
var
  a : string;
begin
  for i := 0 to 20 do
  begin
    if(random(2) = 0)then
    begin
      insert(Chr(65+Random(26)), a, Random(Length(a)));
    end else
    begin
      insert(Chr(97+Random(26)), a, Random(Length(a)));
    end;
    if(random(2) = 0)then
      insert(Chr(48+Random(9)), a, Random(Length(a)));
  end;
  WriteLn(a);
end;
  
begin
  ClearDebug;
  repeat
    Generate;
  until(isfkeydown(12))
end.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: Repeating a writeln
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

when thiswrites in the debug box some of the codes might get repeated, i dont want any of them to ever repeat and i want it to write all the combinations possible. can someone do that for me please???

heres script

[scar]program New;
var i: Integer;
theRandomStuff: string;
const
theString= ‘abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz’;

function randomNumber: integer;
begin
result:= random(10);
end;

function randomLetter: string;
begin
result:= copy(theString, random(25), 1);
end;

procedure generator;
begin
for i:= 1 to random(20) + 5 do
case random(2) of
0: theRandomStuff:= theRandomStuff + inttostr(randomNumber);
1: theRandomStuff:= theRandomStuff + randomLetter;
end;
writeln(theRandomStuff);
end;

begin
repeat
generator;
delete(therandomstuff,1,20+random(5));
until(false);
end.[/scar]
